snippet: The Senate will vote on unemployment benefits. But the House? It’s planning another meaningless, symbolic vote on health care.
abstract: Editorial criticizes the House for planning another meaningless vote to undermine the health care law; compares vote with the Senate's plan to address restoring unemployment benefits to 1.3 million people; contends the contrast between the two chambers underscores the difference in priorities between Democrats and Republicans.
lead_paragraph: The Senate will vote on unemployment benefits. But the House? It’s planning another meaningless, symbolic vote on health care.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
